headline: WATCH: Barr doubles down in slams against Trump in second interview, conservatives blast him on social media
author: DML News App
sentences: Barr said he doesn’t think Trump should be the 2024 Republican nominee, but when pressed on whether he would vote for Trump if he WERE the nominee, Barr said it’s inconceivable to think he wouldn’t vote for the GOP nominee, as he believes the greatest threat to the country is the progressive agenda being pushed by the Democrat Party.

The president is a man who, when he is told something, he doesn’t want to hear, he immediately throws a tantrum and attacks the person personally, so I thought the letter was childish.”
Barr said prior to the election, “I was pretty content with the administration up until the election.

In response to Barr’s interview with Holt, Trump fired off a three-page letter, blasting Barr as “slow, lethargic, and I realized early on that he never had what it takes to make a great Attorney General.”
Trump added, “Bill Barr was not one of my better picks.

After bashing former President Donald Trump in a wide-ranging NBC interview with host Lester Holt, which was broadcast on Sunday, former Attorney General William Barr doubled down again in another interview Monday morning on NBC’s Today Show.

— Jenna Ellis (@JennaEllisEsq) March 7, 2022
Bill Barr’s DOJ had the lap top from hell and did nothing about it
— Liz Harrington (@realLizUSA) March 7, 2022
My nickname for Bill Barr at the Whitehouse was “Fred Flintstone”.

Now he is groveling to the media, hoping to gain acceptance that he doesn’t deserve.”
When presented with Trump’s letter Monday morning on the Today Show, Barr sneered, “It’s par for the course.

He was always hard to work with and resistant to advice… but after the election, he went off the rails.”
On the 2020 election, Barr claimed there was no stealing of the election through fraud.

Worth a read!https://t.co/E0QtZrHEz5
— Jason Miller (@JasonMillerinDC) March 7, 2022
Bill Barr, who I knew personally, is the latest in a long line off self-serving sell-outs.

— Dr.Darrell Scott (@PastorDScott) March 7, 2022
If Bill Barr had done his job in 2020, President Trump would be in the Oval today, and the world wouldn’t be falling apart.
Barr is going on a media blitz to promote his upcoming book, “One Damn Thing After Another: Memoirs of an Attorney General,” about his time in the Trump administration.
